item.description:
The philosophers have their methods, the theologians theirs, but we wander a different road as we seek knowledge of the nature of existence: a pub crawl.

We'll begin at John Harvard's Brew House, and strike out in search of God or his associates in the bottom of a pint glass. We'll hit at least three pubs; candidates include The People's Republik, the Asgard, Tommy Doyle's, River Gods, Daedalus, and/or Charlie's Kitchen.

As we look for the meaning of life, we shall enjoy camaraderie and conversation. The primary purpose of our coming together is mutual enlightenment, not inebriation... be prepared to hold forth on whatever topic is most gripping your attention these days. Bring coats.
item.name: The Search For Truth
